summary: The bill, titled the Reimbursements for Immigration Partnerships with Police to allow Local Enforcement Act of 2025 (RIPPLE Act of 2025), proposes to allow the Attorney General to reimburse states and local political subdivisions for costs associated with the salaries and overtime pay of their employees who perform immigration enforcement functions under agreements with the federal government. These reimbursements would specifically cover wages (as defined by the IRS) and overtime compensation (as defined by the Fair Labor Standards Act).
